module.name: StringQueue
module.short: A first-in, first-out queue for strings
module.descr: A first-in, first-out queue for strings, implemented as a linked list with head and tail pointers. New elements are added to the tail and elements are removed from the head.

element.name: TNode
element.short: Record storing the string data and a pointer to the next record in the queue.

element.name: TNode.Next
element.short: Pointer, PNode, to the next node in the queue.

element.name: TStringQueue
element.short: A first-in, first-out queue for strings
element.descr: A first-in, first-out queue for strings, implemented as a linked list with head and tail pointers. New elements are added to the tail and elements are removed from the head.

element.name: TStringQueue.FSize
element.short: Number of elements in the queue.

element.name: TStringQueue.FHead
element.short: Pointer to the head of the queue.

element.name: TStringQueue.FTail
element.short: Pointer to the tail of the queue.

element.name: TStringQueue.Create
element.descr: Create a new TStringQueue that is empty. The number of elemments in the queue is initialized to zero.

element.name: TStringQueue.Destroy
element.descr: If the queue is not empty, dequeue all elments and dispose of the head pointer.

element.name: TStringQueue.Enqueue
element.short: Add a new element to the queue
element.descr: Add a new element to the queue and increment the number queue elements.

element.name: TStringQueue.Enqueue.token
element.short: The string that will be added to the queue

element.name: TStringQueue.Dequeue
element.short: Remove the next element in the queue and return its data.
element.descr: Remove the next element in the queue and returns its data. D1ecrements the number of elements in the queue.
element.errors: Raises EIndexError if an attempt is made to dequeue from an empty queue.

element.name: TStringQueue.Dequeue.Result
element.short: The string that was removed from the queue.

element.name: TStringQueue.Peek
element.short: Return the string at the front of the queue without removing it.
element.descr: Return the string at the front of the queue without removing it. There is no impact on the number elements in the queue.
element.errors: Raises EIndexError if an attempt is made to peek from an empty queue.

element.name: TStringQueue.Peek.Result
element.short: The string at the front of the queue.

element.name: TStringQueue.IsEmpty
element.short: Returns true if the queue is empty, false otherwise.

element.name: TStringQueue.IsEmpty.Result
element.short: Returns true if the queue is empty, false otherwise.

element.name: TStringQueue.Size
element.short: Returns the number of elements in the queue.
